text: Clear amber pour with aroma of bread and dark fruit. Dark fruit flavor with bread, orange, and caramel. Nice beer.
Draft at the source. Cloudy golden amber color, thick tan head. Aroma of dark fruit, raw brown bread. Taste has sweet plums, raisins. Sweet but decent. Good body.
UPDATED: JUN 22, 2013 On tap at chestnut hill.  Hazy amber off white head.  Malty nose hint of alcohol.  Hoppy spice bite, although mild as malt balances. Alcohol presence is a bit distracting.
On  Tap. Hazy clouded orange pour with a strawberry fruit aroma. At first you notice a tart bread flavor, but it finishes with hints of caramel malt and citrus. It was interesting.

On tap at brew pub.  Pours a deep golden color with a creamy lasting head and plenty of lace.  Smell is perfumey hops, citrus, and some yeasty, wheat bread notes.  Taste is sweet malts that are balanced out by orange zest, floral hops and spice.  Nice carbonation and dry finish.

On Tap in Lancaster.  Aroma of citrus and cloves.  Golden amber body with a dissipating medium head.  Flavor is filled with citrus; orange with hints of clove, Belgian yeast and wheat provide a nice balance. slight spice finish and bitter finish.  Very enjoyable and a great spring beer

Draft at Lancaster. Pours a orange amber with a dissipating off white head. Orange of orange peel and bready malts. Light to medium body with just a tad amount of wateriness in the mouth feel. Flavor of pale Belgian wheat malts, orange peel, and herbal tea. Phenolic finish  that has hints of yeast and white pepper. True to style and enjoyable.
Hazy orange color with fruity/yeasty aroma. Caramel,yeast,and orange peels appear in the flavor. light tart/bitter finish.

Draft @ Iron Hill North Wales.  Pours a hazy, orangish-amber color; off-white head with fine-bubbled lacing.  Pleasant tartness and citrus in the aroma; some tropical fruit and malt sweetness.  Medium-to-full mouthfeel: chewy malts and bready / doughy warmth; a light vanilla presence at mid-palate; medium, doughy and dry malt finish; light citrus hops.
Smells of citrus hops.  Pours a beautiful hazy amber with a white head.  It truely has a spring taste to it.  Hoppy with a malt finish.  It goes down smooth.

Draft at P-ville.  Turbid brownish coppery colored with 2-finger off-white head.  Aroma is hopcitric up front, with a pronounced hop and orangy aroma, plus some floral and spicy notes.  The palate is medium, on the dry side, with a lot of orangy citrus flavors, hops, bready malt, and finishing floral and spicy notes.

Hazy golden-tan color.  Aroma has some lightly toasted bread, yeast, a bit of citrus with a somewhat earthy farmhouse character.  Flavor is quite doughy - bits of citrus and light fruit, lots of rustic/earthy grains.  Pleasant and very drinkable.

On tap at the Blind Tiger. Cloudy brown/orange color with a medium sized off white head. Yeasty, fruity aroma with notes of caramel. Lightly sweet malty flavor, with some caramel, stone fruit and a grassy, mildly tart finish.

Draught at North Wales.  Cloudy warm golden-straw body with a velvety off-white head.  Aroma of nutty malt, toasted banana, grapes, and bread crust.  Flavor is drier than anticipated with a fruity apricot note, some caramelization, nice complex yeast characters, and light but distinct tartness.  A marked step up from previous biere de gardes made by Iron Hill.  I like this one quite a bit.

Tap at Blind Tiger.  Deep orange beer that is very cloudy.  Aroma is fresh and fruity.  Cherry/berry and strawberry with a soft earthy component.  Dusty and sweetly honeyish with light bready maltiness.  Very spicy with loads of fruity esters.  Its okay, but its not great.

Tap at Blind Tiger - cloudy red/copper with a substantial head - light, lively aroma of wet grass, citrus rinds, some bready/yeasty qualities - crisp and refreshing, with the malt not too forward or sweet; it just makes some bread and biscuit character to get the palate working, ending with mild tartness and refreshing citrus fruitiness - a bit of earthy notes throughout - not spectacular, but a nice spring beer.

Tap at Norht Wales, after the reccomendation from Whaleman.  Pours a tremendousy cloudy dirty off brown, deep copper, (kinda like my old unpollished wort chiller color).  Decent fluffy off white cobwebby head as well.  Aroma is cookie-dough, yeasty, bready, lightly sweet , hints of caramel, and a bit musty.  Good doughy full flavor, lightly sweet malts, toffee, hints of phenolics, and a light tart citrus character in the end which made it nice and refreshing.  Nice Biere de Mars.

10oz glass on tap at the North Wales location. Poured a dark and muddy amber color with a smaller sized off white head. Aromas of spices, bananas, caramel, citrus and yeast. Tastes of fruitiness, citrus, earthy, spices and toffee. I enjoyed this one!

Poured a cloudy orange-amber color with a  nice thin head, decent retention and lacing. The aroma was a bit earthy, caramel, and citrusey (oranges works moreso than lemony). Flavor followed suit, all of that with some tofee and light spice also mixed in there. Mouthfeel was dry, somewhat lightly acidic, moderate unfiltered body. A nice refreshing summer beer to enjoy.

Poured a murky orange brown color with a medium sized, off white head that left light lacing on the glass.  Aroma of toffee malts, light spices, ash, floral hops, and light yeast as well.  Taste of more spices, caramel malts, tart citrus fruits, orange peel, light butter, toasted dough, earthy yeast, and faint alcohol in the finish.

Draught at North Wales. Hazy orange body with a nice head that disappeared too quickly. Aroma is of spices, cloves, light yeast. Flavor is spices, cloves, yeast, and some earthiness. Sweet and lightly bitter. Crisp, very drinkable.
